spots.name: Sagrada Família
spots.comment: Gaudí's masterpiece—go early to avoid crowds.

spots.name: Park Güell
spots.comment: Iconic mosaics and sweeping city views.

spots.name: La Boqueria Market
spots.comment: Fresh juices and tapas stalls—busy but worth it.

spots.name: Barceloneta Beach
spots.comment: Nice for a sunset stroll; avoid peak midday heat.

spots.name: Bunkers del Carmel
spots.comment: Best panoramic sunset spot in the city.

spots.name: Casa Batlló
spots.comment: Facade is stunning; interior tour if you're a Gaudí fan.

spots.name: El Nacional
spots.comment: Upscale food hall—good for groups with varied tastes.

spots.name: El Xampanyet
spots.comment: Classic cava and tapas bar; arrive early to snag a spot.

spots.name: Gothic Quarter (Barri Gòtic)
spots.comment: Wander the narrow streets—great for photos.

spots.name: Montjuïc Magic Fountain
spots.comment: Light and music show nights—check schedule.

spots.name: Sant Antoni Market
spots.comment: Less touristy than Boqueria; excellent produce.

spots.name: Can Paixano (La Xampanyeria)
spots.comment: Cheap cava, packed vibe—watch your belongings.

spots.name: Las Ramblas
spots.comment: Too touristy and pickpocket-prone—pass through quickly.

spots.name: Camp Nou (Spotify Camp Nou)
spots.comment: Stadium tour for Barça fans; area is otherwise quiet.

spots.name: Palau de la Música Catalana
spots.comment: Modernist concert hall—take the guided tour.

spots.name: El Born Centre de Cultura
spots.comment: Archaeology meets culture in a beautiful iron market hall.

spots.name: Carretera de les Aigües
spots.comment: Scenic running/walking trail with city views.

spots.name: Tibidabo
spots.comment: Vintage amusement park and a church with views.

spots.name: Casa Milà (La Pedrera)
spots.comment: Rooftop chimneys are the highlight.

spots.name: Parc de la Ciutadella
spots.comment: Relaxing green space; rent a rowboat if you like.

spots.name: Mercat de la Boqueria
spots.comment: Great for a quick bite—go before noon.

spots.name: El Raval Street Art
spots.comment: Murals and gritty vibe—good daytime stroll.

spots.name: Plaça Reial
spots.comment: Lively square; decent tapas and people-watching.

spots.name: Museu Picasso
spots.comment: Reserve tickets—excellent early works collection.

spots.name: Sants Locals Tapas
spots.comment: Local neighborhood tapas—friendly prices.

spots.name: La Barceloneta Paella Spot
spots.comment: Seafood paella near the beach—touristy but tasty.

spots.name: Arc de Triomf
spots.comment: Nice photo stop on the way to Ciutadella.

spots.name: Montjuïc Castle
spots.comment: Cable car ride is fun; views over the port.

spots.name: Poble Sec Pintxos Street
spots.comment: Carrer de Blai for pintxos hopping.

spots.name: Hospital de Sant Pau
spots.comment: Stunning modernist complex—less crowded than Sagrada.

spots.name: Eixample Grid Walk
spots.comment: Iconic chamfered corners and cafes everywhere.

spots.name: Port Vell Boardwalk
spots.comment: Evening walk with sea breeze and street performers.

spots.name: Columbus Monument
spots.comment: Skip the elevator up—views aren't worth the wait.

spots.name: Gràcia Plazas Crawl
spots.comment: Plaça del Sol and friends—cozy bars and vibes.

spots.name: Passeig de Gràcia Shopping
spots.comment: High-end shopping and architecture together.

spots.name: Mercat de Sant Antoni Sunday Books
spots.comment: Weekend book market around the perimeter.

spots.name: W Hotel Lookout
spots.comment: Cocktail with a view—pricey but scenic.

spots.name: Carmel Bunkers Alternate Path
spots.comment: Less crowded ascent via the park trails.

spots.name: Diagonal Mar Park
spots.comment: Modern park with water features—family friendly.

spots.name: Sant Pau Recinte Modernista
spots.comment: Architectural gem—combine with Sagrada visit.

spots.name: Casa Vicens
spots.comment: Early Gaudí house—quieter than other sites.

spots.name: Parc del Laberint d'Horta
spots.comment: Neoclassical maze—great for a calm morning.

spots.name: Mercat de Sant Andreu
spots.comment: Neighborhood market—authentic local feel.

spots.name: Born Tapas Alley
spots.comment: Tapas crawl around Passeig del Born.

spots.name: Palau Güell
spots.comment: Gaudí townhouse with ornate interiors.

spots.name: MNAC - Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya
spots.comment: Romanesque collection and city views from steps.

spots.name: Parc de Montjuïc Cactus Garden
spots.comment: Jardins de Mossèn Costa i Llobera—unique plants and vistas.

spots.name: Mercat de la Concepció
spots.comment: Flower market early morning is lovely.

spots.name: Torre Glòries View
spots.comment: Observation deck with a cool data art installation.

spots.name: Razzmatazz Club
spots.comment: Big multi-room club—best on weekends.

spots.name: Plaça de Sant Felip Neri
spots.comment: Quiet historic square; poignant history.

spots.name: Parc del Poblenou Beach Stretch
spots.comment: Less crowded than Barceloneta; good for runs.

spots.name: Maremagnum Sunset Spot
spots.comment: Harbor views; grab gelato nearby.

spots.name: Tourist Trap Paella Row
spots.comment: Avoid set menus here—seek local recs instead.

spots.name: Jardins del Turó del Putxet
spots.comment: Small hill park, peaceful at golden hour.

spots.name: Arenas de Barcelona Rooftop
spots.comment: Circular mall rooftop walk with views.

spots.name: Carrer de Petritxol Chocolaterias
spots.comment: Hot chocolate and churros lane—sweet stop.

spots.name: Passeig Marítim Sunrise Run
spots.comment: Quiet early morning seaside path—perfect run.
